This app is one of the worst I have on my phone. It‚Äôs incredibly slow to load, barely responsive after it opens, and plagued with minor issues that combine to constantly frustrate. 
Starting with the delivery option, you end up getting forced to the location the app decides is best. In some cases, this is a Wal-Mart store that has such a limited menu you can‚Äôt find anything you were actually going to order. Other times, it will direct you to the most overpriced franchisee that you avoid like the plague. No control over where your delivery is coming from can be a huge problem. 
Next, their payment system seems to work as frequently as the ice cream machines in the US. I end up not being able to pay through their app. If I‚Äôm at a location, that‚Äôs a minor inconvenience if I‚Äôm in store or doing drive through, but makes the other options like curbside or table service untenable. 
Lastly getting support for order issues isn‚Äôt straight forward. For example, when the store forgets to include or sends the wrong items, you have to go through a couple pages to get to the phone number that you call to get the refund through door dash.  They don‚Äôt seem to want to support their own platform and offload things so they have the option to claim ignorance when things go wrong. 
Overall, the app is plagued with an inordinate amount of minor issues that create problems with many aspects of ordering. As a points and rewards app it‚Äôs ok, but the clunky performance make that frustrating as well. I‚Äôll continue to use it, but know it also serves as a strong suggestion to patronize other businesses when I‚Äôm trying to patronize McDonalds.

I‚Äôve had the app for years and years ago it was a great app but now it‚Äôs more of an inconvenience to use then anything. If you are patient it might be for you but I‚Äôve lost my patience. First off the app has started to run considerably slow and lags often. Second when you want to use one of the discounts or deals or whatnot the app will give you several but it‚Äôs trapped behind either a delivery only or in the restaurant only step. You‚Äôre in the parking lot looking at deals and you see a $2 McDouble, awesome but then you realize you have to have it delivered somewhere‚Ä¶ it ruins the mood. Third, they changed it so that every time you bring up a code for collecting points or redeeming, if your phone turns off it will give you a new code when you turn your phone back on, not all that bad but it is annoying when you were familiar with something so long. 

It‚Äôs gotten to the point where it‚Äôs easier to just wait for coupons in the mail, and honestly the couple will likely end up being a better deal then whatever you can get in the app anyway. I had to delete it for peace of mind because collecting the points just wasn‚Äôt worth it to me anymore, but if you have the patience to deal with a janky app that lags and takes it‚Äôs sweet time loading the next screen if it means getting a free McDouble after spending $60 it might be the app for you.

The deals themselves are abysmal and there are the points that expire before you can use them unless you‚Äôre a walking heart attack waiting to happen. Just more confirmation of why it‚Äôs so easy to disregard the nostalgia cravings that lead to McDonald‚Äôs. McDonald‚Äôs is very clearly on a slow march into obscurity and irrelevance and I‚Äôm thoroughly enjoying it. Reap what you sow and all that.
